definition: life/to survive/to save a life/to scrape a living
to live/alive/living/work/workmanship
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: I know, it gets cold so quickly.
sentences.chinese: 我可以如此靠饮动物的血活命吗？

sentences.english: Of course money can get him the best health care possible but no money can buy insurance for a life.
sentences.chinese: 当然钱可以给他最好的医疗看护但不能保证活命。

sentences.english: My spirit pant for Thee O living word.
sentences.chinese: 我心欣慕救主活命道理。

sentences.english: But the prospect of failing to survive was not merely frightening, as she had expected.
sentences.chinese: 可是不能活命的预感，岂止是她预料的可怕而已？

sentences.english: Every flatterer lives at the expense of those who listen to him.
sentences.chinese: 阿舆奉承的人是靠听信谗言的人活命的。

sentences.english: Bless the Lord my soul, who leads me into life. (Taize)
sentences.chinese: 我心赞美主，祂互我得活命。

sentences.english: 3 soldiers said that they wanted to live.
sentences.chinese: 三个士兵说当然想活命。

definition: to survive/to keep on living
through road/way out/way to survive/means of subsistence
labor/physical work
a way to make a living/a way to survive/a way out of a predicament
to escape/to flee/to run for one's life
to escape/to flee/to run away
life
to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
to defend oneself/self-defense/self-preservation
to save one's life/to survive
(idiom) dead end/road to ruin
hands tied and waiting to be captured
intact corpse/dead body with no parts missing
to get away/to escape (from obligations)/to free oneself/to disengage
to survive
to return alive/to survive
to wait helplessly for death (idiom)/to resign oneself to extinction
